intro: Myosotis muricata, commonly known as the rough forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers and hairy, ribbed stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Myosotis muricata is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features.
